meanings.definition: Words that sound alike but have different meanings.
meanings.sent1: Homonyms can be confusing because they sound the same.
meanings.sent2: English has many homonyms that can make learning the language tricky.
meanings.sent3: The homonyms danced around in my head, making it hard to focus.
meanings.sent4: Her words were like homonyms, deceiving in their similarity but holding different truths.
meanings.sent5: The teacher used homonyms in the lesson to show how words can have multiple meanings.

meanings.definition: Words that are spelled the same but have different meanings.
meanings.sent1: I learned about homonyms in school, words that look the same but mean different things.
meanings.sent2: Homonyms like 'bat' can mean a flying mammal or a piece of sports equipment.
meanings.sent3: The homonyms on the page seemed to play tricks on my eyes.
meanings.sent4: Her notebook was filled with homonyms, each word a puzzle waiting to be solved.
meanings.sent5: The book explained homonyms by using examples from everyday life.

meanings.definition: Words that are pronounced the same but have different meanings.
meanings.sent1: Homonyms can be tricky because they sound the same when spoken.
meanings.sent2: In some languages, homonyms are more common than in others.
meanings.sent3: The homonyms in the poem added a layer of complexity to its meaning.
meanings.sent4: His speech was full of homonyms, each one a surprise waiting to be discovered.
meanings.sent5: The radio show played a game with homonyms, challenging listeners to guess the correct meaning.
